steps.directions: Heat oven to 375°F. Blend all ingredients thoroughly and spread in greased 9-inch round pan.
Mix ingredients together until crumbly to form the topping. Sprinkle over batter. Bake for 25 to 30 min, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm.
Put dry ingredients in a large bowl, stir well. Add just enough warm water to make a soft dough. Mix until all flour is absorbed. Cover and let set 30 min.

Heat 1 to 2 inches of oil in a deep skillet to 350°F. Divide dough into 12 equal portions; shape each into a ball. Flatten each ball into a 6-inch round about 1/4 inch thick. Fry rounds in hot oil until golden brown on both sides, turning once. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Cut in shortening. Stir in vinegar and milk until dough is sticky. Spoon onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden brown.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners. Beat egg; stir in milk and oil. Add remaining ingredients until moistened. Bake 15 to 18 minutes.
Dissolve yeast in warm water. Preheat oven to 400°F.
Scald milk, and then add margarine, sugar, and salt. Let cool, then add the yeast that was dissolved in water.
Add flour, making a soft dough. Knead 2 minutes. Let rise until double in size. Punch down and divide into 4 portions.

ingredients: Pizza toppings of choice (pepperoni, vegetables, etc.)
steps.directions: Spread each portion of dough in a 9-inch cake pan. Top with pizza sauce, cheese, and desired toppings. Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
Cream sugars and margarine.
Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add and blend until all flour disappears.
Stir in chocolate chips. Scoop by rounded spoonfools onto baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart. Bake at 350°F for 13 minutes or until edges begin to brown.
Combine and let activate.
Add 2 cups flour to yeast mixture, stir well. Then add eggs & salt, stir. Add remaining flour. Knead 10 minutes. If dough is too sticky to handle, add additional flour.

Let rise until double in size. Punch down, and form into 24 rolls, place on parchment paper lined baking sheet. Let rise again. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until golden brown. For shiny tops, brush with butter while hot.
Preheat oven to 350°F and grease a 9x5 loaf pan.
Whisk together the flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, beat eggs and melted butter; stir in mashed bananas. Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake 55-65 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely.
Preheat oven to 400°F and line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper liners.
Whisk together the dry ingredients in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk milk, oil, and egg. Pour into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Gently fold in blueberries, divide batter among muffin cups and bake 18-22 minutes until golden. Cool on a rack.
Mix ingredients, autolyse 30 minutes, stretch and fold over 3 hours, shape and proof overnight. Bake in a dutch oven at 450°F for 30-40 minutes.
Make an enriched dough by combining the dry ingredients and adding milk, butter, and egg. Knead until smooth and let rise until doubled.
Roll dough into a rectangle, spread with softened butter, and sprinkle cinnamon sugar evenly over the surface.
Roll the dough tightly, cut into 12 slices, place in a baking pan, let rise until puffy, then bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.
Optional: glaze rolls with icing made from powdered sugar and milk after slightly cooling.
Make the shortbread crust by cutting butter into flour and powdered sugar until crumbly, press into a pan and bake 15-18 minutes at 350°F.
Whisk together eggs, sugar, lemon juice, zest and flour until smooth to make the lemon filling.
Pour the filling over the pre-baked crust and bake for an additional 18-22 minutes until set. Chill completely and dust with powdered sugar before serving.
Cream butter and sugars, add eggs and vanilla, mix dry ingredients, fold in oats. Drop by spoonfuls and bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
Combine dry ingredients, mix in wet ingredients until combined. Pour into loaf pan and bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Blind bake crust, combine berries with sugar and cornstarch, fill crust and bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes. Cool before serving.
Toss apples with sugar, flour and spices. Fill crust, cover, and bake at 400°F for 45-55 minutes.
Cream butter and sugar, mix in flour and salt, press into pan or shape and bake at 325°F for 18-22 minutes until lightly golden.
Combine crumbs and melted butter, press into the bottom of a springform pan and bake at 325°F for 8-10 minutes to set the crust.
Beat cream cheese until smooth, add sugar and vanilla, then add eggs one at a time until incorporated to make the filling.
Pour filling over crust and bake at 325°F for 60-75 minutes until the center is just set. Cool to room temperature, then chill at least 4 hours.
Mix dough, let rise until doubled, press into oiled pan, dimple and top with herbs. Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
Mix dough, bulk ferment, shape into baguettes, final proof, and bake at 475°F with steam for 20-25 minutes.
Make dough, shape pretzels, briefly boil in baking soda bath, sprinkle with coarse salt, and bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes.
Make an enriched dough by combining ingredients, knead until smooth, then chill until cold.
Laminate the dough: roll out, place butter block, fold and chill repeatedly (typically 3-4 turns) to create layers.
Roll the laminated dough, cut triangles, shape croissants, proof until puffy, then bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes until golden.
Form logs, bake at 350°F, slice and bake again until crisp.
Combine, pour into loaf pan and bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Mix and bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes in two 9-inch pans. Cool and frost with cream cheese frosting.
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and flour alternately. Bake at 350°F for 60-75 minutes.
Melt butter, stir in sugar and eggs, add dry ingredients. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.
Mix filling, pour into crust and bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Cut rounds from crust, fill with cherry filling, fold and crimp. Brush with egg wash and bake at 375°F for 18-22 minutes.
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and flour, fold in lemon. Bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Mix and bake in a skillet at 400°F for 20-25 minutes.
Macreate strawberries with sugar. Make biscuits or shortcakes from dough and bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes. Split and fill with strawberries and whipped cream.
Layer phyllo with butter and nuts, bake at 350°F until golden, then pour hot honey-sugar syrup over cooled baklava.
Cut in butter, add milk to form dough, shape into rounds, cut into wedges and bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.
Mix dry ingredients, cut in butter, fold in pecans and maple, shape and bake 18-22 minutes at 400°F.
Combine wet and dry, fold in cranberries and orange zest, bake 18-22 minutes at 375°F.
Prepare batter, pipe into molds and bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
Slice loaf into cubes, toss with garlic butter and parmesan, bake until crisp and golden.
Mix, fill muffin tin and bake at 375°F for 18-22 minutes.
Blend ingredients, press into pan, bake 20 minutes at 350°F, cool and cut.
Mix and knead dough, let rise, shape and bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes.
Mix, drop spoonfuls and bake 12-15 minutes at 350°F.
Mix and bake in loaf pan at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
Make dough, shape into bagels, boil briefly, and bake at 425°F for 18-22 minutes.
Mix, chill dough, roll into balls, coat with sugar and bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
Combine ingredients, spoon into muffin tin and bake 18-22 minutes at 400°F.
Cream butter and sugar, add matcha and flour, chill and bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
Mix and fry spoonfuls in oil until golden. Drain and serve warm.
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and dry ingredients, bake in cupcake tins at 350°F for 18-22 minutes.
Mix ingredients, chill, shape and bake at 350°F for 12-14 minutes.
Fill dough with banana and honey, roll, proof and bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes.
Prepare batter, top with crumb and blueberries, bake 35-40 minutes at 350°F.
Mix, press into pan and bake 20-25 minutes at 350°F. Cool and slice.
Fill pre-baked shells with ganache, top with hazelnuts and chill until set.
Fill squares of pastry, fold into turnovers, brush with egg and bake at 400°F for 18-20 minutes.
Mix and bake in muffin tin at 400°F for 15-18 minutes. Brush with honey butter.
Bake crust, add coconut custard and chill until set; top with whipped cream.
Combine and bake at 375°F for 18-22 minutes.
Melt chocolate and butter, fold with eggs and dry ingredients, bake at 425°F for 10-12 minutes until edges set and centers soft.
Make enriched dough with sweet potato, shape rolls, proof and bake at 375°F for 18-22 minutes.
Drop dough balls, bake 8-10 minutes and press chocolate kiss into warm cookie.
Layer jam over base, sprinkle almonds and bake until golden.
Layer cocoa filling into rolled dough, twist, proof and bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes.
Pipe into donut pan and bake 10-12 minutes, cool and glaze with orange icing.
Spread mustard and cheese on pastry, fold and twist, bake until golden.
Mix, knead, proof and bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes.
Pipe choux, sprinkle cheese and bake until puffed and golden.
Mix and bake 18-22 minutes at 375°F.
Toss bread and apples with custard, bake until set, serve with caramel.
Roll into sticks, brush with butter and vanilla sugar, bake until golden.
Mix, knead, proof and bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes.
Roll dough, fill with cardamom sugar, twist into buns and bake at 375°F until golden.
Prepare batter, bake in financier molds at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
Mix and bake in a pan at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until set.
Swirl caramel into batter and bake; sprinkle sea salt when cooled.
Mix, press into pan, bake at 325°F for 18-22 minutes.
Press dough into pan, dimple, add oil and herbs and bake until golden.
Mix, chill dough, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
Form small balls, fry until golden and toss in cinnamon sugar.
Spread nutella, roll and twist, proof and bake until glossy and golden.
Mix, shape scones and bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.
Cut in butter, fold in scallions and cheese and bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes.
Fill croissants with almond paste, bake and top with sliced almonds and glaze.
Fry donuts until golden and toss in cardamom sugar while warm.
Roll out dough, fill, roll up and slice, proof and bake. Serve warm with glaze.
Fill squares of dough with sweetened cream cheese, fold and bake at 400°F for 15-18 minutes until golden.
Tie small strips of dough into knots, bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes, toss with garlic butter.
